author: Special Correspondent
text:
A fishermen welfare forum has urged the Centre and State governments to secure the release of 23 fishermen from the State, who were reportedly restrained by their employers for more than two years in the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

The fishermen - native of Kanyakumari, Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts - were being denied food and were left in the streets with their documents confiscated, following an incident in April 2014, when a fisherman died after falling in the sea while fishing, Fr. Churchil, IVD, General Secretary of South Asian Fishermen Fraternity said.

Though the police authorities let them off after an inquiry into the incident, their employers had detained them for over 50 days, before they were let out, he alleged. “From that day, the abandoned fishermen are supported by the Tamil people in Sharjah for their food and accommodation,” he said.

The forum demanded the Centre to appoint a legal assistance to represent the fishermen in Abu Dhabi court and repatriate all the 23 fishermen.

“The government of Tamil Nadu has to give relief to the families of the 23 fishermen. Tamil Nadu government has to insist the Centre for their release and repatriation,” he urged.

‘They were denied food and left in the streets with their documents confiscated’
title: Forum calls for rescue of 23 fishermen from UAE
